revisions.*:
'''Karen Carroll''' (born January 30, 1958, [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], [[United States]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[Chicago blues]] singer.<ref name="AMG"/> She was born to parents Mack Carroll and Alberta Simmons Carroll ([[stage name]]: Jeanne Carroll).<ref>{{cite web|author=Helge Strauß |url=http://www.bluescontact.de/jeanne_carroll/index.html |title=Bluescontact - Jeanne Carroll |publisher=Bluescontact.de |date= |accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref> Her [[godparent]]s were the [[jazz]] guitarist [[George Freeman (guitarist)|George Freeman]] and blues vocalist [[Bonnie Lee]].<ref name="AMG">{{cite web |first= |last= |url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p62757/biography|pure_url=yes}} |title=Biography by Jason Ankeny |publisher=Allmusic.com |accessdate=July 16, 2011}}</ref>

==Biography==
Carroll started singing in church at the age of six.<ref>{{cite web|author=Karen Carroll; |url=http://www.reverbnation.com/#!/karencarroll |title=Biography - Karen Carroll |publisher=Reverbnation.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-16}}</ref> Her first appearance was on stage playing guitar with her mother's band at age 14.<ref>{{cite web|author=karen carroll; |url=http://www.bluescontact.de/karen_carroll/vita_e.html |title=Bluescontact - Karen Carroll |publisher=Bluescontact.de |date= |accessdate=2011-07-16}}</ref> Early in her career she worked with [[Katie Webster]] and [[Albert King]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Karen Carroll |url=http://www.reverbnation.com/#!/karencarroll |title=Biography - Karen Carroll|publisher=Reverbnation.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-16}}</ref>
She recorded her first song with [[Carey Bell]] on his [[album]], ''Son of a Gun'' in 1983.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thebluescollective.blogspot.com/search/label/Lurrie%20Bell |title=thebluescollective: Lurrie Bell |publisher=Thebluescollective.blogspot.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref> Carroll went on to tour with Eddie Lusk in [[Canada]], after recording his album ''Professor Strut'' in 1989.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delmark.com/delmark.650.htm |title=Eddie Lusk - Professor Strut |publisher=Delmark.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref>  Karen went on to play at some big Chicago blues [[nightclub|clubs]]. In 1995, Carroll worked on an album with five other female blues artists called ''Women of Blue Chicago'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delmark.com/delmark.690.htm |title=Women of Blue Chicago |publisher=Delmark.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref> and it is still being played on the radio today.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.z100.com/iplaylist/artist/62757 |title=Karen Carroll | Z100 - Z100 - New York's Hit Music Station |publisher=Z100 |date= |accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref> She was offered her own [[recording contract]] by [[Delmark Records]] in 1995, subsequently making the album ''Had My Fun''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delmark.com/delmark.680.htm |title=Carroll "Had My Fun" |publisher=Delmark.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref>  This was followed by another [[Sound recording and reproduction|recording]], ''Talk to the Hand'' in 1997. Some of the tracks on the album Carroll wrote and holds copyright for.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delmark.com/delmark.707.htm |title=Karen Carroll - Talk to the Hand |publisher=Delmark.com |date= |accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref> 

Over the years she has worked with many Chicago blues musicians such as Carey and [[Lurrie Bell]], [[Rudy Rotta]], [[Otis Grand]], [[Angela Brown]], [[Billy Branch]], [[Melvin Taylor]], [[Eddy Clearwater]], [[Lonnie Brooks]], [[Alvin Lee]], [[Byther Smith]] and [[Sugar Blue]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Helge Strauß |url=http://www.bluescontact.de/karen_carroll/vita_e.html |title=Bluescontact - Karen Carroll / vita |publisher=Bluescontact.de |date=2010-05-08 |accessdate=2011-07-13}}</ref>

In 2008, she released ''Be My Guest!'' on Indigoteam Records.<ref name="AMG"/>

==Solo discography==
*1989: ''Professor Strut''  ([[Delmark Records|Delmark]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delmark.com/delmark.650.htm |title=Eddie Lusk - Professor Strut |publisher=Delmark.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*1995: ''Had My Fun'' (Delmark)
*1997: ''Talk to the Hand'' (Delmark)
*2007: ''Live in Oleśnica'' (Stowarzyszenie Jazz Kanapie)<ref>[http://www.jazznakanapie.pl/?pg=5 ]{{dead link|date=October 2013}}</ref>
*2008: ''Be My Guest!'' (Indigoteam)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/be-my-guest%21-mw0001756025 |title=Be My Guest! - Karen Carroll | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*2009: ''Evolution Revolution'' (Gryllus)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.songs.hu/album/id/1879 |title=Evolution Revolution - Karen Carroll With The Mississippi GraveDiggers - Albums |publisher=Songs.hu |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*2010: ''Ghetto Love'' (unsigned)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reverbnation.com/store/view_item_album/artist_21588?item_id=1079004 |title=The Karen Carroll Store |publisher=Reverbnation.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*2011: ''Karen Carroll's Blues Mix'' (unsigned)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/dp/B005EVJMFE |title=Karen Carroll's Blues Mix: Karen Carroll: MP3 Downloads |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bmansbluesreport.com/2011/11/new-release-karen-carrolls-blues-mix.html |title=Bman's Blues Report: New Release: Karen Carroll's Blues Mix - review |publisher=Bmansbluesreport.com |date=2011-11-28 |accessdate=2011-12-30}}</ref>

==Collaboration with other artists==
*1984: ''Son of a Gun'' ([[P-Vine Records|P-Vine]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/search/xx/music/pid/5310390/a/Son+Of+A+Gun.htm |title=Carey Bell - Son Of A Gun CD Album |publisher=Cduniverse.com |date=2002-12-03 |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*1990: ''Gospel'' (Hot-Foks)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Karen-CarrollBruce-Thompson-Gospel/release/1686875 |title=Karen CarrollBruce Thompson - Gospel (CD) at Discogs |publisher=Discogs.com |date=1990-01-01 |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*1993: ''Stock Yards Strut'' (Delmark)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delmark.com/delmark.229.htm |title=Stompers "Stock Yard Strut" |publisher=Delmark.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*1993: ''Chicago's Finest Blues Ladies'' ([[Wolf Records|Wolf]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://avaxhome.ws/music/blues/VA.Chicagos.Finest.Blues.Ladies.Chicago.Blues.Session.Vol.28.html |title=VA - Chicago's Finest Blues Ladies (1993) [Chicago Blues Session Vol. 28] |publisher=Avaxhome.ws |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*1994: ''Johnny B. Moore, Live at Blue Chicago'' (Blue Chicago)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/search/xx/music/pid/1187162/a/Live+At+Blue+Chicago.htm |title=Johnny B Moore - Live at Blue Chicago CD Album |publisher=Cduniverse.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*1997: ''Red Hot Mamas'' (Blue Chicago)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00000013X |title=Red Hot Mamas: Music |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*1998: ''Delmark Records 45 Years Of Jazz And Blues'' (Delmark)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00000DFH7 |title=Delmark Records: 45 Years Of Jazz And Blues: Music |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*2003: ''Delmark 50th Anniversary Cd Collection'' (Delmark)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cduniverse.com/productinfo.asp?pid=6050739 |title=Chicago's Avant Today: Delmark 50th Anniversary Collection CD Album |publisher=Cduniverse.com |date=2003-08-05 |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*2003: ''Wild About That Thing: Ladies Sing The Blues'' (Delmark)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bizrate.com/blues-music/woman/ |title=Woman Blues Music |publisher=Bizrate |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref>
*2011: ''First Class Blues (feat. Karen Carroll, Big Jay McNeely)'' (Acoustic Music Records)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/dp/B005HJMXD6 |title=First Class Blues (feat. Karen Carroll, Big Jay McNeely): First Class Blues Band: MP3 Downloads |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Karen-CarrollBruce-Thompson-Gospel/release/1686875 |title=Karen CarrollBruce Thompson - Gospel (CD) at Discogs |publisher=Discogs.com |date=1990-01-01 |accessdate=2012-04-08}}</ref>
